metadata.title: Trial of the Take Part 2 ft. FELICIA DAY

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back! (giggles) Welcome back. We got most everyone here right now. Travis is on his way. He flew all the way from Alaska, and thanks to some delays-- weather and everything-- he's getting here as fast as he can, so we may have a Grog arriving a little late during today's session.  Pretty late for today's session. But in the meantime, our illustrious Laura Bailey will be controlling Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) I would like to rage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Excited for that prospect. It should be a lot of fun. So also want to thank you again, our invited guests returning for their second week. We have Felicia Day and Mary Elizabeth McGlynn. Thank you, guys.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Pleasure is mine.

lines.name: LAURA, MARY
lines.text: Pleasure.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Pleasure. I smell like peanut butter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's delightful.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's why I smelled my fingers earlier.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Is this a normal thing, or just today?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I just was like, hi! (sniffs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's normally how people greet me.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: If you smelled like grape jelly, we would be BFFs! Anyway, hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And it doesn't look like some self-published thing, that looks like a real-- whoa!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Not to insult self-published things, but it's legit. There is a sparkle on my dress. That is a very high-class sparkle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does it have a barcode on it?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Anyway, thank you, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome, cool, well you guys get some copies of that coming through. We also have a bunch of other random goodies we'll be throwing in with these packages that include other awesome DND stuff and comics and it'll be a little surprise, so for every 100 subscribers, we'll be giving one of those packages away, so that'll be fun. Also wanted to do a quick announcement for one of our friends recently put up a project here. Marisha, if you want to do the intro.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes! Hi everybody. Okay, so. Boonzy Arts-- they make geeky candles. They have a Kickstarter right now called Wheel of Flame, and they're making essentially DND thematic immersive candles that smell like the environments that you're in! This one is Dragon's Lair and it's smoky and musky.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to be lighting this tonight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there moldy dungeon smell?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're coming out with a few more because their Kickstarter's doing pretty well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Basement tavern refuse candle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ogre's nest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think they're making a tavern one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bed crap? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a Critical Role exclusive. The Scanlan offshoot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I think they have one that's Elven Forest, that smells like a forest and they have one that's Sorcerer's Lair, that smells like sage and stuff. But yeah, Wheel of Flame is their Kickstarter. Go check them out, I know they have a limited amount of candles they can give out. Also, there's a d20 hidden in every candle, so when the wax melts, you get a d20!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's lovely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So yeah! Check them out. Wheel of Flame.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So much flame. So yeah, for all you guys who pay the extra subscription dollars for the smell-o-vision twitch stream, you will be able to also experience the sensory death of the party.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why would you say that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys picked it. But yeah, so that's actually pretty cool. Hopefully there's not a flammable d20 in there somewhere. That would be problematic.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That was weird.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That happens all the time.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Is it really just random kiss-bys? Drive-by kiss?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two weeks in a row. We already have a winner?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: PrimeJohn1.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: PrimeJohn1 is our first winner! Congratulations, PrimeJohn1.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: PJ Uno!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Did you have to rename him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I gave him a nickname to the nickname.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's really adorable. It's a sub-nickname.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A sub-nick! (laughter)

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It'll eventually just be like (grunts).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone else have any other announcements they want to say before we get into the game?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Travis and I will be in Vancouver next weekend. Not this coming weekend, but the weekend after. But we're not going to be here next week, so yeah, should say that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome, so in Vancouver?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a con. And you should come say hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In Vancouver.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In Vancouver. Go look at my Twitter. You'll see what it is about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Vancouver convention. Laura and Travis; it's going to be awesome. Also, me and Marisha are flying out early morning tomorrow to a convention called AkaiCon that's over in Tennessee, so we'll be there this weekend. So if any of you guys are over there on the eastern seaboard and that vicinity that want to come say hi and hang out with us for the weekend, we have a bunch of fun panels and stuff, so. AkaiCon. Come say hi.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Or is that you? No, it's not you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Homeopathic VapoRub, really.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wow, I do smell it now. Yeah, that's nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing fun right now.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Does it smell like ogre butt, because isn't that what we're doing? Troll butt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where we left off. Our party of adventurers, Vox Machina, had broken a few rules in the city of Vasselheim and had actually infracted upon a contract for a guild of creature hunters known as the Slayer's Take. And this group essentially told Vox Machina that either they could go and be arrested for this and put on trial for breaking the law, or they could go and join the guild, as such could be included and written onto the contract and everything would be fine. So they decided to go that route. They inquired with the Huntmaster, and she basically told the party that they could join after they went through a trial where they had to complete a contract. However, she hand-chose and divided the party into two separate, smaller groups. The first group being the one that began playing with us last week, in which we had the illustrious Scanlan, Percy, Vex, and Grog paired up with two new adventurers, one of which was Zahra the tiefling warlock, who also is a prospective interested person to join the guild, the Slayer's Take, and Felicia's character, Lyra, the human wizard, who somehow became a member of the guild and is assigned on her first-ever excursion to lead this group towards the end of their contract. Now, you the audience chose the creature which they were going to hunt, and you voted on an adult white dragon. So they've been hunting that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't realize the audience chose that.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You went to inquire what was in there, at which point out of nowhere, a giant rock made of solid ice and stone was flung out of the forest, slamming into Vex, knocking her onto her ass and doing a decent amount of physical damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 30. 30 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 points physical damage to the ranger, at which point two frost giants seemed to, one coming out of that cavern, another seemed to be stalking through the woods, approached the party and that is where we left off. So to begin this, I would like everyone to roll initiative.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: But they're friendly. They look friendly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's try reasoning with them. Whoa! That's not bad

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm not going to go last this time! (gasps)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a lot of gasping going on.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's not horrible but it's not (sharp gasp).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, does Travis not--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Roll for Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for Grog's initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled 18 for me. Oh, that's good. 19 for Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so we have 25 to 20, anyone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He rolled a natural 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled another natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Those dice are magic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I sacrificed a small child to these dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Percy's up first. Anybody else above 20?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I rolled a 20, but I have a negative two initiative.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. 19 or 18?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 19 for Grog. 18 for Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And also for Lyra.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: 18 buddies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckling) That's sweet. So 15 to ten?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These are pretty good initiatives.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, then we're all above 13, it's pretty good! This bodes well.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that'll do. So at the top of the round as one giant has pulled itself out of the cavern and begins shouting over in Giant about the intruders. The secondary one that comes stalking out of the forest, both of them with these giant axes that are currently held on the side of leather belts (roars) give a bellowing scream and go charging into the fray. At the top of the round, though, Percy is ready. What have you got?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is that strange orange thing, right here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is actually a tree.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a tree. Okay, good. So that's cover?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. This rock and these boulders here have some cover, but from a giant who has a very large perspective maybe not as much as you'd think.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so is there any way I can maybe get some partial cover right over here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could move over this way, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. So I've got cover from the tree from this one until he moves, but I can see this guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is Bad News time! I'm going to bust out Bad News and take a shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. Rip out Bad News, uses one of your attacks, second attack prepares it. You're ready to fire, go ahead and shoot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. They're pretty big, so I'm going to take the negative five to my attack bonus and see what that does. That's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 will hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a good shot. Oh yeah! That's 17, 27, plus-- 33 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 33 points of damage? Nice. So you hear this loud, ringing explosion that echoes through this small valley at the base of the mountain, and from out the corner of your eye, it's the first time you've seen this weapon do its wonders. You see a flash of light, a plume of smoke goes up and you see this impossibly fast blast of some projectile go slamming into the shoulder of the giant over here that's currently reaching for a rock. It pushes him back against the wall, which prevents him from falling over and he catches himself. Looks back, and you can see there's a small crater in the armor where a little bit of blood begins to pour out, and a little bit of smoke seems to be pouring out of the impact. (snarls and yells) Gives out a really angry yell. You can see like spittle that begins to shake loose and spray from his mouth out of frustration. That the end of your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It was very impressive. It was very impressive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Grog's up first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) Grog--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (Grog voice) Would like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) No, Grog doesn't want to Rage! Grog shouts out in Giant, wait! My giant masters were killed by a white dragon, which we think is here. Will you help us fight him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as Grog stands there, shouting this out to both sides to the two giants, I want to have Grog go ahead and roll a persuasion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I am going to use Grog's dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Let's do this proper. This is customary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is proper. Wait. Okay. That's not his, that is mine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (Grog voice) I would like to negotiate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Well that is good. He is really happy that I am playing him, because I rolled a one for Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I should not-- okay. Wait!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Doesn't Grog get two actions or no?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's his action.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is not putting up any aggressive action.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he get advantage, however, because he is speaking Giant and he's in the cold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you have an entire band of seemingly advancing and armed individuals that are currently stalking towards what appears to be the home of these individuals. So unfortunately no. They seem unfazed, and the one at the back seems almost partially amused at this plea and you can see as he takes his axe and puts it up against his shoulder and runs it across the leather in a very aggressive, intimidating fashion as he stalks forward out of the forest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) Can Grog move at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, would you like Grog to move? It would be easier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) Where is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is right here. He is hard to miss. Where would you like Grog to move? There is a giant rock there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He is going to stay there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A moment of silence for that horrible thing I just witnessed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are over here. You just got up off the ground after being slammed with a boulder, and you have Trinket there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am very hurt. Can I get up? Am I prone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the process you've gotten to your feet as they lurched forward and began shouting at each other about the intruders. So you are on your feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I am going to cast Hunter's Mark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hunter's Mark. On?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am going to shoot him three times. Can I shoot him three times?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have two attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That probably doesn't hit. 14 also doesn't hit the second time. Oh my god! What is happening?! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She just disappeared!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Vex! Vex, stay with us! Vex!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you get to your feet, you look over your shoulder, you point your finger out and as you squint down, you use your ranger focus to make sure this guy is your quarry, and you take a quick scope of his body parts. You're like, those are the areas that will make him weakest. As you go to pull your arrow, you can feel a kink in your shoulder. The impact of the rock seems to have affected you. You release the first arrow and it's just slightly off mark. The second one you pull back and as you release it, it actually splinters off his shield as he knocks it out of the air.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am going to run over to cover. What is that other side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is one of the mountain outcroppings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I am going to hide in that little thing and go, Trinket hide with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Trinket moves up. (bear moan) All right, and that's your turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's all of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right, Lyra, you're up.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay, I am freaked out right now. These are very large individuals. I have only read about them, and they smell slightly like feet. So I am going to-- that is a stench. That is like an athlete's foot commercial waiting to happen. So I am going to take 10d6 and do Disintegrate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I mean, it seems excessive, but they're very large men! One, two, three, four, five-- That one, he looks like a bull. In the nether-regions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So which one, this one or this one?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I don't think I can reach that guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the distance on it?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At your spell sheet.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Disintegrate. Oh, there it is! 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 60 feet? Yeah, they're both within range.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh gosh, well I should probably hit the wounded one. That always makes RPG sense, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So for that one, do you have to make an actual spell attack roll?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No, I don't. I think it's force damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right. You just point at it and he has to roll a saving throw.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh yay! Look at that! Six! Six! Six!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All this time trying to fight the stigma of DND, and there we go.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Talking to my people here!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: All right. That's 20 plus-- now you're all staring at me! 30, 40 points of damage!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a total of 40? Plus 40?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: 40 plus 40.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, Disintegrate. And he failed his saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: In your anus! That's what she yells, she's like, in your anus!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as she shouts, she points her finger out, there's a little poof of arcane energy on her finger, and a tiny, sickly green ray of energy just streaks forth from her finger. The giant looks at it awkwardly, and in the split second it hits him in the front of his chest and suddenly the armor in front of him turns to dust and you can see his flesh beginning to just disappear in front of him (gasps) and suddenly tries to gasp for air, as you see part of its jaw beginning to just turn to sand, and it's actually struggling in a series of pain, and it's still standing, but you can see a large part of its body now is just missing. It looks like it got-- it's almost like a portion of it rotted right before you, but there's no actual necrosis. It's just gone. Flesh is missing from a large part of its body. It looks like it's doing really poorly. It lurches forward, and one of its arms is not working as well and it looks at you with a look of confusion, frustration and "how could you?." It's incredulous in its torturous pain.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: And I go, (gibberish) in Giant and it's the only thing I know in Giant, and I think it says, you are my foe, and I actually say, my cat is your friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Its head turns even further to the side as the tongue lolls out of where the cheek once was.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Take that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) Its angry white eyes glaring aggressively at you. Do you wish to move, or would you like to stay where you are?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, I think I'm going to duck behind that little outcropping I have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over here?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yeah, no, behind that little rock-- oh, where am I? Oh, I'm over there. Yeah, I'm going to get-- oh boy. Just stand there, I'm just too flushed right now. I can't go anywhere. This is too situational for me

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Well, (chuckles) this very unhappy giant is going to reach over with his one good arm, the other one's clutching the axe, it reaches over and grabs another rock off the ground that it can find nearby and (whoosh) flings it at you.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I should have moved! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 16. What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You, unable to really move out of the way, you look over and just watch it come toward you as it slowly spins in the air. Time seems to slow as you make no intent to shift out of the way. (whack) It slams into you, physical pain not hitting in as the immediate look of-- the sight of white, your vision is knocked to nothingness briefly. You end up taking--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, Lyra, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you take 32 points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Whoa! That is a very intense amount of damage for a tiny woman. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You should avoid those boulders in the future.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys, Zahra and Scanlan, as you see this happening you hear the (heavy steps) heavy footfalls behind you, and you look over your shoulder as the second giant comes up with the shield in one arm. Axe is going to go ahead and giant swing towards the two of you. That is going to be a 19 to hit on you, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 points of slashing damage to you, Scanlan. Ooh. All right. And that is 31 points of slashing damage to you, Zahra. As it just (whack), cleaves through the both of you. You are almost knocked off your feet from the sheer blow. Most of the armor takes the damage but you can feel a heavy bruise, and underneath your armor you can feel a little bit of the blood beginning to soak through from the severe impact. Part of the armor plating might have cut into part of your torso (grunts) but you right yourself there. That ends their turn. That brings us to Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Hey, question. If I hold a turn, do I hold the whole turn? Can I hold my action but do the bonus action? How does it work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got to take all your turn at once. You can hold your initiative. Meaning you can wait to activate your turn later in the tier, but you can't piecemeal your actions.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, then I am going to just move. I am going to act. I am going to do things. So I turn to the guy who just hit me, and I am going to cast Dominate Person on him. I will sing some sort of song to dominate him with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say, Dominate Person is effective against humanoids.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (gasps) Really?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dominate Monster would be--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're not humanoid?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would know that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would know that. Well, then, I guess I won't do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You turn, and your instinct is there, and you're like, these are a little out of your reach as far as that spell is concerned.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It is a very short show tonight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've got options!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I go for the guy who-- I'll do (blows raspberry). I'll cast Lightning Bolt on him. That's always a good go-to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you fumble with the idea of what spell would work, you release a bolt of lightning up towards it. It streaks into the front of its chest and shoulder area. You can see its muscles tense and shake from the sheer amount of electricity that courses into it. It does not make that saving throw, not with a five. So go ahead and roll your damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it six or eight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's 8d6.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you! Okay. Six, six, four. What is that?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, really? Oh, that's awesome! Now I lost track. 32.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 32 points of damage. Nice! So as you release the torrent of electrical energy, it courses through the body and ends up streaking off into the snowy, blizzardy sky behind the giant from the upward angle. It (grunts) shakes from the impact, and then rights itself and looks down at you with a really angry face. You can see as it opens its mouth, this light blue and dark teeth on the bottom of its beard-covered jaw. Mist and steam tend to pour out of its mouth. But not like heated steam, this is like a cold air itself that it seems to emanate from it. Its pale whitish-blue hair, slightly framing its form. Up close, at its sheer size, this is a very intimidating creature, as it just stares down looming over you, now with smoke pouring off its shoulder where you impacted it with the Lightning Bolt. Do you want to do any--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't roll it now, but you just have it on reserve whenever you want to use it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Love it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And if I move away from him he'll hit me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He'll get an attack of opportunity, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I snuggle between his legs and maybe he'll forget I'm there?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: He's hung like a horse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're going to hit yourself in the head

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes! Yes, Scanlan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to try and do that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just stay put.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Zahra, you're up.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, I have a question. Do they understand English?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are not aware, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he said intruder when we came in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You heard him say it in Giant. It was understood by Grog that it was intruder.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. They're both within about 30 feet of me, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. They're both within 30 feet of you

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right! I'm going to use one of my skills that I have which it doesn't expel a spell slot and use Awakened Mind and touch them both with telekinesis, and in doing so I shall cast Mass Suggestion, and I shall say to them, you will take us to your enemy, the white dragon, and there we shall slay it together. Then you shall return us here safely, where we shall part as friends bonded forever in the slaying of a common enemy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you're looking out at the two of them, you release this energy, speaking through your mind, reaching out to theirs. What is the DC of your spell? It should be at the top of your spell list, the difficulty class.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spell save DC. Top right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Spell save DC is a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, all right. So both of them seem to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you add your inspiration? Add your inspiration!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Inspiration has to be added to a roll.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: My charisma is added to any spell that I cast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to do anything else? You can still move. You still have a bonus action, if you want

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What do you mean bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your Hex is a bonus action, but that is a spell, as well.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: If I move away from them though...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He can hit you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If he's going to hit you. He might not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true! Your spell might have worked.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I shall go and protect Scanlan, underneath the legs of that giant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you move in to help defend Scanlan.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: He's so tiny, I love little guys. I always have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's a mother figure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to hold my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Percy's holding initiative. Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I say, in Giant, (in Grog voice) What say you? Let's fight this bastard. Together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, they look at Grog, confused. Look at each other again. That's Grog's turn, Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously? While everybody's having a conversation, I would like to take a healing potion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and take one of those

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. How much do I take for a superior?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Superior? Superior is 8d4 plus eight. It's quite a bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It is, so just regular healing potion for now. Which is what, 2d8?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A regular is 2d4 plus two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay! That's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lyra.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm confused. But I do not feel good; I might throw up. So I'm going to hold my turn to see what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, for the barf.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, it's a five! Constitution five. It's a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is the most adorable barfing sound you guys have ever heard, though. The combination of the stress and the smell, it's been a harrowing experience for Lyra in these past few minutes. At this point in time, as it comes to the giants' turn. The one who is messed up looks over to the other and (sighs) puts the axe into his belt loop, and the other also one puts its axe in the belt loop, and they glare at the rest of the group, and say in Giant, (gibberish). And any of you speak Giant? Or just Grog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog translates. Essentially, they say, "We will take you but it is at your own folly."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (in Grog voice) They'll take us, but it is at our own folly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take us as in-- Grog, can you ask them, take us as in lead us or on their back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (strangled gibberish) Which translates to, take us as in lead us or carry us on your back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both chuckle to themselves, and they start walking in towards the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait! Can we rest a little before we go fight this thing so we can get spell slots back and heal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we? Yes! Yes!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Up to 24 hours. This one lasts the whole day. Yeah, can we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It lasts for 24 hours.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Mass Suggestion lasts for 24 hours.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that is good information.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh and very important: none of us can damage these two giants. Anything else can, we're fine, but should any of us damage it, the spell is poof.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they going to fight with us? Grog? Will you ask them if they're going to fight with us? (gibberish)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How does it go, again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (repeats previous gibberish)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. One of them looks over the shoulder as it's walking into the cavern and puts its hand on the top and leans over and its voice, and I will say from this point forth it is translated to make it easier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just like in Hunt for Red October?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Perhaps the dragon will eat you. That'll keep it satiated for a while." It steps inside the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) I think that's a no.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yeah. And I say (speaks gibberish). My cat is your friend!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bless you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that you partially disintegrated earlier steps out and goes, (spitting noise) and spits a-- what in midair looks like liquid and then (shattering) shatters into almost like crystalline ice as it hits the ground on a rock.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It is just rude. He smells so much like feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll Mass Suggest that they take a bath later.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's take a breather. For a moment, collect ourselves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wish I wouldn't have wasted a healing potion just then because we can take some--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: We can heal our 1d6 plus three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys step inside the cavern. You guys are taking a short rest, currently?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Short rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so the giants are just sitting there waiting, arms crossed against the wall, talking quietly to each other as the rest of you sit down and bandage your wounds. You tend to your adrenaline as it slowly wears off and suddenly the pain starts to set in from some of the wounds you've taken. So you guys can use as many hit dice as you want to heal yourselves.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So what do I do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You roll a d8. You can roll up to 11d8, plus two for each time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, DM.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many hit points do I have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't taken damage at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have they increased at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is true. You leveled up after the last one. So with this short rest I will say go ahead and roll an additional-- for a bard I think it is a d8, correct?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your hit dice number?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And what's your constitution?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 15. Plus two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so go ahead and roll a d8 plus two to it

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also get access to your first 6th-level spell.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What!?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? Get some stuff before we fight a dragon, yo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got it already. I am ready to rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good. Good choice. You take the next half an hour or so to rest up. You still used your Disintegrate. You need to do a whole night's rest to get that back.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh! I don't get it? It's six spell levels.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is six spell levels you can get back on a short rest?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Short rest. Recover six spell levels because I have arcane recovery. So I can actually get that back

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) Wizards are awesome!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) Grog would like to take his Chain of Returning off of one of the axes he had it on and put onto the Firebrand Warhammer that he took off of that dwarf in Kraghammer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The mean guy he took it off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Off of, that was King Murghol, I think, wasn't it? The duergar king you fought in the Underdark.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I have a question. So I rolled to get my health back and I got more hit points than I had before--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't go more than your maximum. You're at full hit points now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Anything we should know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since Grog is translating, I'm going to go ahead and have you roll a persuasion check.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Wrong dice! Why did you use that dice?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was feeling weak. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten. And I want you to roll a persuasion check for Grog with disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great. Oh, that was a good roll, come on also good roll.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It wasn't a good roll. I see a face there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was a one, wasn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the crits were last week.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is my fault. This is all my fault.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: You are a plague. Your good fortune is a plague upon your friends.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Travis is going to be so pissed when he gets here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He'll be dead by the time he gets here

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His flight landed. I got a text. His flight has landed. He's on his way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great, awesome. As Grog finishes translating (gibberish) to the giants, the giants chuckle to themselves and the other one says down to him, what he translates for you, the equivalent of, "There's no help here. They killed our people, but we're alive because we serve it. We'll bring you, "like we promised, like we brought all the others."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They serve the dragon?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Can we look around? Are there any dragon tips around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You took a rest inside the cavern as you just entered the mountain and at this point as you guys step up the giants are leading you further into the cavern.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: May I talk to him, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know Giant?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, through Grog. I have telekinesis, so can I speak to one of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, telekinesis and telepathy are different things.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, I mean, I have Awakened Mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh right. So you can speak directly to their minds

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes. Your people have been persecuted for so long, and you have lost so many of the female version of you, and your children, and you serve them now. Do you want to live as slaves?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We want to live."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So to live as a slave is better than--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To not live at all?"

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We are offering you the opportunity to stop your servitude. To end it forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts) They keep walking

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll see how this plays out. This is a process here. You guys heavily failed some early persuasion rolls here, they're in a very negative position with you right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry about that.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Let's not bring it up again. I love your hair.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's really cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So about 200 feet further into this cavern, the tunnel opens up into a gargantuan natural rock chamber, coated in ice crystals across the entirety of the rounded crag in the ceiling. You can see now as the light you're bringing into-- by the way, is anyone bringing a source of light other than the torchlight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, Grog lights his blazing axe.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I cast Light on my dark dragon staff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all bundle up even tighter with your various furs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I snuggle very close to Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket snuggles very close to you because Trinket, while made for this type of temperature, is still uncomfortably cold, even at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did Lyra give me--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I did! I gave you my stone. My Transmutation Stone, which helps you resist cold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, I feel so warm and cuddly.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, don't brag about it. Oh my gosh, my mom told me never bring-- well, she's dead, but before she died, she told me if you can't bring one for everybody, don't bring any. So just be quiet about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm sorry. I was just distracted because we're in a dire situation and I miss the love of my life, Pike. I'm sure you can't identify with that.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh no! I was just thinking the other day, just outside the cavern, if Aldor was here--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aldor?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes! Did I tell you about him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A little.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: We'll get over that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we have something in common then and thank you for your stone of warmth or whatever it was.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's a cold resistance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll just call it a stone of warmth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You ain't getting past 30.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: May I again, sorry, use Awakened Mind to ask the giant what happened here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as you see these visions, you begin to step further into this village and you can see there are spires, large spires of crystallized ice, and loosely within the shadows of the ice you can see what looks like the suffocated forms of frost giants that are locked in that position under many feet of ice. You see most of this village brought to its knees and destroyed, murdered, eaten, or imprisoned and these two, essentially chosen to survive and given the order to bring what this creature wants.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: There's only two of you left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get this sense of sadness and fear, but also a sense of a lack of any other option.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, how I wish we could release you from these bonds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a way to, like, melt the spires? (whispers) I interrupted you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: To release them.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: They are dead in there though, right?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, I know but at least maybe they could-- Do you have some burial ritual or anything that you would like to or do these stand as a painful remembrance for you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a moment where it seems almost like it's going to answer, and then the mind closes off suddenly. There is a defensiveness and these entities, you get the sense that even this tenuous relationship you have built with them is based purely on arcane persuasion, and the more you pry, the more you begin to test the boundaries of what you have done. Pick and choose your words very carefully.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Zahra sheds a tear, which freezes instantly on her face, and her internal flame melts it off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's pretty badass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue to walk, you can see the center of this village is completely in tatters. A lot of the wood and the dried brush and the furs and thick leathers that these giants had gathered and constructed their civilization out of is all just shattered and rended to the floor and then frozen over, left in this weird picturesque, almost a tapestry. A frozen moment in time of utter desolation. Actually, I want you to all to roll a perception check, if you could.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! No we're not in-- 14.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Uno.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Almost like a 25, 30 foot sculpture of chaos. All of these things have been matted together with what looks like mud and refuse, and as you guys begin to notice this, too, you catch the framing of the light on it and it seems to be built into almost an altar or a large sculpture of worship of a winged dragon creature that is currently in the process of swooping down. You get the sensation that this was built as, essentially, a place of offering to this white dragon, and hopefully a symbol to keep themselves alive and to prove their fealty to this entity.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I have a spell called Legend Lore. Can I cast that on white dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see what Legend Lore does.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about the thing you named: current tales, forgotten stories, secret lore that has never been widely known. If it is not of legendary importance, you gain no information. Would I think that this is a legendary dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has an intelligence, but it seems to not be concerned with the intricacies of conversation as much as it is to bend everything to its will and to give (voices deepens) to me. (normally) And the one thing that catches your mind before the spell ends is the name that it finally came upon itself, the name that it heard whispered as one of its would-be hunters was suddenly--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jeff the dragon. The name Rimefang rings through your mind.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: His name is Rimefang.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two frost giants stop their walking and turn. "Rimefang." They nod and look up to the giant structure they constructed.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh wow! Can I make a history to sww if I know anyone in the guild who has been named Rimefang?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check on this.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Rimefang, you gather, is the name of the dragon proper. And there's another drink for you guys out there. They made fun of me for using the word proper.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Drink!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This dragon took the name Rimefang. Because in a lot of dragons as they evolve and begin to really create a lair, they really make themselves known publicly and really draw the fear out once they feel they're in a comfortable position. You feel this dragon is just starting to get to that point where it's eager to drive fear into the local populace. From your history check, you do know that there is, somewhere in the books you've gone through, a similar contract, nothing Rimefang related, but there was a white dragon that was supposedly hunted about eight, nine months back, and the team never returned. And you begin to think, "Wait, so if a team of really practiced "people never returned from this contract, and we were sent on this as an entry level..."

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Hey, guys? I have a suspicion that maybe the guild didn't want us to succeed. And I don't want to panic anybody. I just don't think Vanessa--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Lyra, do you have any enemies in the guild?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well. Everyone seems to be very-- I make a very good soup and I help people with their laundry sometimes and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, are you like an assistant?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No, I'm a guild member, I just like to be helpful. Like you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was just wondering.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's a paperwork thing.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: If you don't mind my asking because I do respect you so much, how did your captainship of our crew come about?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: But there may not be a next one, guys. That's what I'm saying.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, were you Vanessa's assistant? I mean, before you were a member?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No. Aldor. I'm here with Aldor, remember?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you think we've been sent on some sort of suicide mission--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, that's good, the way you put it there!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'm a master of words. Should we abandon all hope and just flee? Is that what you're suggesting as our leader? Or should we carry it through and prove everyone wrong?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: If we abandon this quest, then we never-- I could get kicked out of the guild, for one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happens if the contract that we magically signed doesn't ever come to fruition?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's not good. Let me think.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what? Retrace your steps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which means if you were to not succeed at the contract, you would probably be put on trial at the seat of judgment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy is very good at lawyering.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am. I lawyer quite well, but the hope is that we wouldn't actually break the contract in the first place, because that's complicated.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I wasn't part of this band of breaking the law. I'm here to gain entry into this guild.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, you certainly won't get into the guild if you break the contract.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, I completely understand, but I won't be brought to trial. Not that I'm all, "well it's all about me," but I'm serious. That's why I'm here! My motivations are not to save my ass, my motivations are to get into this bloody guild!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not here based on other people's expectations. We're here because we thought we could handle this and nothing has changed. This changes nothing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We are very capable fighters!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I've seen this. You have proven yourselves already. Those orcs didn't stand a bloody chance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: So we go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We go. Well actually, Grog-- could someone ask Ace and Gary if we're there or if we have further to travel?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: We'll just keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Grog mentions this, you guys have moved past most of the village, and you've gone towards the back of this large chamber, and you do see what appears to be a tunnel that ascends upwards, deeper into the mountain proper. See, did it again. It's made me all self-conscious. But the entrance is entirely frozen. There is a wall of solid ice between yourselves and the continuation of this tunnel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) How thick is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to see how thick it is from this side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (Grog voice) Can Grog run at it and try to bash it really fast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys step up, Grog runs ahead of the rest of the giants and goes as hard as he can towards this. (laughs) So swinging with the axe towards the ice. Go ahead and make an attack roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a hammer, which I feel would be better against ice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This giant flaming warhammer from King Murghol.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like every dice is betraying me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would you like to use mine?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm going to curse yours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, turn it around. Shake the Wil Wheaton curse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll just leave it at that. It slipped out of my hands, but I'm going to keep it. 15 plus what, eight? Plus nine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus nine. That'll definitely hit. Go ahead and roll damage for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Here we go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hope he can hit a wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, with my ones as of late. Oh, that's just ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten damage? Including the fire damage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yes, right. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 damage. (whack) The warhammer streaks through, the light causing this interesting shifting of the radius around it. As it smacks into the ice with this resounding (thwack) sound, the ice shakes and shimmers. A giant crack forms up the front of it, and you can see as he (grunts) pulls it out, the wall itself seems to have largely crumbled in the small space there and looks very fragile. But it's definitely left an impact on the wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can make an attempt at this. I'm going to walk over and study the shattering position and see if I can find the weak point in the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven. Getting it all out of my system now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ice wall itself is not a specific architectural structure. It is made of some sort of blasting of ice that froze the air in that way, so it doesn't have any real geometric positioning, but the ice structure itself, you're unable to make out what would be a weak point or not, other than the place of impact where Grog placed the hammer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a musket ball, go over to the very center of the crack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we keep a little more quiet than that?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Can I use a Fire Bolt? That would be good, a Fire Bolt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's save the Fire Bolt.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No, it's a cantrip. Is that okay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm backing up.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm the leader. I'm going to say I'm going to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She said, Fire Bolt. I backed away.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: And that is 1d8 fire damage, which is seven. Seven fire damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and roll to see if you hit with it. So roll and add your spell attack modifier.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: What is that? Oh, it's 12... plus 11. So that is 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that definitely hits. How much damage? That was seven fire damage, you said?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, it's 3d10 fire. Sorry. Because of my level. Which is seven and five and seven is 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Clutching your staff at one side, the book's under your shoulder, you bring your hand out and withdraw your hand with the force of the blast of the Fire Bolt going forward. As it smacks into the section where Grog had slammed the hammer, (boof) it bursts as a flash of arcane reddish fiery energy, and the wall itself shatters inward and starts falling and crumbling nearby. Now, this tall wall, which was about 25 feet tall, begins to fall in giant chunks.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: (yelps) Sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to go ahead and have Lyra and Percy and Grog all make dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, I'm so good at that, with the negatives. Oh!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't use acrobatics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not for this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 21 for Grog.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I rolled a zero, because I've got a negative two. It's not even on the dice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Is that worse than a critical fail?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, though, Lyra and Percy stumble backward, slipping on the ice that's actually coated the floor of this cavern, and get impacted with part of the fall. It's not too bad, but both of you suffer 14 points of cold damage and bludgeoning. Cold and bludgeoning, as the wall comes tumbling down on you. However, the rest of the cavern now lies open with pieces of jagged ice almost like a broken glass window itself framing the exterior of this tunnel.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm not going to go to the front anymore, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you're the leader, shouldn't you be--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should protect her. She should be towards the back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to heal really quickly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take another short rest?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should take a short rest so that we're going in, you know.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yeah. I had scoliosis as a child. I'm not nimble. It's funny.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Before we take a short rest may I, again, use Awakened Mind, just to see how far away we are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get an image of a slowly ascending and spiraling tunnel that ascends towards an upper cavern at the top of the mountain. The upper cavern you only get a few glimpses of as they themselves have only had a few glimpses of it, but it appears this is not the only obstacle in the way.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's carry on then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you see when you were looking into their mind if it is open or if it is just a big cavern?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I could not see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the best vantage point you could see, it was a chamber about, I'd say 80 to 85 feet to the ceiling, lined with jagged ice crystals that are coalesced in a temperature so cold that it's almost like the inside of a geode, but it's all made of ice. But you see multiple platforms that are risen in the walls of this, and in the center, there is a singular platform, and there sitting on the top of it is apparently the dragon quarry you seek. And then the image shuts itself out, as one of them glances over the shoulder. It's growing uncomfortable with sharing information.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Got it. I thank him in my mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Pressing forward, you can see one giant still dragging itself forward with a portion of its physical body essentially gutted.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What if we gave him a half healing potion?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't mess with the magic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because, here's the thing. If they fight with us, it's great, but if they turn on us then we are going to have to fight them at full power again.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah, but we have 24 hours.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, but the healing potion might do something. Let's just keep going. You are a very kind soul.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So are you guys taking a short rest to heal up? Okay. If you haven't already rolled your dice-- You healed up now? Perfect. All right, so as you guys continue to trudge up this extremely cold-- let me see. I think it'll be a fun one to-- There we go. You guys continue to ascend up this pitch-black cavern here. It appears that both the giants and the dragon do not need light to make their way through this cavern structure. So you are the small beads of visual lightness in the entire structure. The floor itself is slick, and there are bits of rough rock that you can find foot purchase but there are a few moments where some of you slip and you lose about ten feet and then catch yourself and have to move upward with this slight 35-degree incline, slowly spiraling upward. You push forward for about 30 minutes or so in this long, seemingly-- for lack of a better term, there isn't a lot of changed variation to it; it's just a gradual spiral in itself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to keep perception out to make sure that nothing is ahead of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, but this is pertaining to dragons. He is one of my favored enemies, so I have additional bonuses to tracking him and insight against him. Favored enemies!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you're perceiving anything dragon-related and things that would be a forewarning of a dragon, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stuff like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll again. You have an advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, just to see. Okay. 18?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Glancing about, you do see there are claw marks along the walls, you can see where portions of this cavern were carved out by the claws of Rimefang. You can see that occasionally there are pieces of frozen rock that are solid ice, some that appear to be an unthawed chunk of flesh of some kind. As you push further up this cavern, you spot what looks like the lower half of a statue.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Ugh. That's a-- oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's unpleasant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Half of a giant, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is ice encasing the lower half of it. It's interesting because the physical form of the frost giants resist cold naturally, and this temperature would normally freeze any other flesh completely solid. Here, it naturally decays. But there is a distinct place where the torso was removed forcibly by what looks like a series of daggers and/or dragon's teeth.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I have little ginger chews, if anybody wants one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take one.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Here you go. Thank you. Just in my little pack here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About ten more minutes of walking, you come upon another frozen wall barrier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will check it for traps!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll perception.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Thanks, brother.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you can tell, it is a frost/snow-covered ground with walls and a ceiling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone. There are definitely no traps here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good. Maybe we should stay back?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's a good idea, and a leader idea that I had that you just reminded me of.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good thinking, Lyra.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's a nine and a ten and five. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of it falls and collapses at a distance, (crashing) around you. Thankfully, you're all far enough away where there isn't an issue, and the wall seems to have shattered.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's the way you do it! Thank you. Oh my gosh, you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before we move forward, I've studied dragons a lot. I just want to say. So obviously we all know they're susceptible to fire damage, yes? This is an ice-breathing bastard. Do as much fire attacks as we can.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes. Don't dragons love, especially white ones, shiny, sparkly things? Especially gems, from what I've gleaned over the years.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If he could be distracted during combat, maybe.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: A very aggressive person. I got a glimpse of his attitude, and it is not pleasant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not happy.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No. He is full of bile and vitriol, and he likes to be worshiped. We could pretend to be worshiping him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he'll still want to eat us. But yes, we could do that.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I mean, he didn't eat these two guys!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It might be something to think about.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: At least to get close to him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before we spring an attack, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an intelligence check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With advantage because it's pertaining to dragons?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) She's a stickler.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that an insight check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's just adding your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, let me see what that-- oh, that's Grog's. What am I doing? Okay, so 20 was the first roll. 20 is the high roll. Oh, wait! No! 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Okay. A few things you do know about dragons, specifically a white dragon, from your studying. You lost someone very important to you, supposedly to a dragon, and so you've spent a lot of your life focused on their techniques, their abilities, how they work. White dragons, you know, have complete immunity to cold. Cold damage of all sorts has no effect on them whatsoever. You know that they have capability of flight. They surround themselves with ice but are not hindered by it whatsoever. You do know that their claws and teeth are extremely dangerous. They themselves also, using their wings and tail, become a fierce entity from all sides. Its cold breath is extremely dangerous. It can affect a large area, and even its presence is frightful enough to where some of the most seasoned adventurers go running, fleeing, or cowering in a corner. Let alone encountering one in its lair, itself, it already has an advantage, as it sets an environment to put it at its advantage. So anything and everything you can do to prepare and be ready for such an encounter would be highly recommended. You do get the sensation that even though they are cold-based, fire doesn't necessarily do any additional damage, but it is not reduced or able to resist it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It can't resist fire. What about lightning damage? Do I know anything about that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best that you know, most magics and other types of damage other than cold have an effect on it, though it does have unnatural resilience to spells and things for a large part of the combat.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I can cast Stoneskin on one person. Or up to, actually-- I could cast Stoneskin up to three times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it's a concentration spell, so you can only have it up on one person.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I can only have it on one person at a time. So who would be most likely to resist slashing and bludgeoning and piercing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably Grog. He's going to be the one that's going to be up close, out of all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Grog says, "That's all right. If I'm raging, I already have the ability to resist."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. He takes half to piercing and slashing.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, okay. So then we need the other person who might be within range.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA, MARY
lines.text: Trinket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Trinket's here? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look over. (sad bear moan)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's right there, Scanlan.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I don't want to demean him, but his performance is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lyra!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I love him. Of course he gets the spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He is really, really cool!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He does things!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes, of course, I don't know what I was thinking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here's the thing. If he doesn't have Stoneskin, I probably won't let him charge.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But if he does have Stoneskin, will you let him charge?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: All right, well, that could be another-- Does that seem like a good idea for a bear?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Scanlan, are most of your attacks up close or are they far?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got a wide range. I like to keep people guessing. It's my thing.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: But we wouldn't really want you within claw damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wouldn't want that, either.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It does make more-- I don't mean to demean Trinket, he is a lovely bear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Top five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're saying this, Trinket senses the conversation and plants both feet in the ground (growls).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: See how tough he is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems to be showing off. And for a moment, even though it's a conversation, that's a dangerous-looking bear.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I use Beast Speak on Trinket. And say, Trinket, what are you feeling right now? What's going on? You seem very excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket says to you, essentially, "I'll do whatever it takes to protect my Vex. If this "creature tries anything, I will tear its throat from its head."

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: He's a sexier bear than I thought he was.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he gives good massages, Lyra.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay. So I will cast Stoneskin. It lasts an hour, so I'll cast it within the perimeter that we think we're going to get hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell him that I love him very much!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I also want to tell you, Trinket. First of all, boy or girl? Just have to check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's a boy! Look at his giant dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He leans back in a sitting bear position.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Thank you, I needed some inspiration for this fight we're about to do. All right. I also want you to know that Vex loves you very much and will do whatever she can to protect you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this guttural conversation comes forth, Trinket comes up to you and nuzzles his nose up against your side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, little buddy!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I wish Aldor would do that to me.

lines.name: SAM, MARY
lines.text: Show his giant cock to you? (laughter)

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I saw it once. It was glorious.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Very inspiring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Lyra's in this memory trance, finishes casting Stoneskin and reaches out and touches Trinket. You can see Trinket's physical form, all the fur seems to coalesce into a thick rock-type exterior shell of magical protection.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does his armor class raise by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Armor class doesn't change, but all damage that Trinket takes from bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing is reduced by half.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Thank you, Trinket, lovely to talk to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What else can we do to prepare?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I promise, Lyra, I will let him attack this battle.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh good, no, it's fantastic. That invited so many good thoughts in my mind. I don't mind anything at this point. I mean, what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The giants begin to move forward into the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's happening.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yep. Screw your courage to the sticking-place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ew. Oh. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Scanlan, I want you to go ahead and roll a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy, already? Dex. 17. Oh. Plus four. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. As you begin stepping forward up the cavern where the wall itself has collapsed, you step forward onto a part of the ice that is far more brittle than you expected, and suddenly it (cracks) breaks beneath your foot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My Scanlan-sense is tingling!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And peering over the inside and using your light, you can see there appears to be an arrangement of razor-sharp ice spikes gathered at the bottom of a 15-foot pit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? Why isn't my brother here? I need to check for traps from now on. Snoop ahead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we've found one. There's a trap right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does that take up our whole path now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The tunnel itself is about 20 feet wide at this point, so you guys can move around it. The giants were ahead of you at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did they laugh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them shakes his head and the other one just keeps walking.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Gee, I had a spell that would be useful, but it's not ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thanks for that update.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm just being honest. I could've lied, said that I totally prepared that spell, but I could've been knowing Giant the whole time, so I just.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Oops.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: If anybody falls, I can make them fall gently. That's on the list.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good. Is that Feather Fall? Nice. Okay, I perceive some more and see if I see any traps ahead of us the whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You go ahead and make a perception check as you move forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be a seven. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15, okay. You guys continue to push upwards this long spiraling corridor. You reach another ice wall that has already been partially broken from some sort of encounter long ago. You immediately see that the part of the wall that is broken. There's about a ten-foot-wide blocked passage, the entirety of that walkway appears to be another trap, and the giants are waiting back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have one job on this ship!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I know it's stupid, but goddamn it, I'm going to do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we get around? What do we do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should maybe break down this ice wall and then not walk on this area. How about that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Okay. Let's, yes.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, good. Should I Firebolt? I mean, I'm going to Firebolt. From a distance.

lines.name: LAURA, FELICIA, MARY, SAM
lines.text: (singing) From a distance, the world is...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Beaches.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's a 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30. Go ahead and roll some damage.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yeah! Nine and eight and a ten, these are good rolls. That's a 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27. This bolt arcs around from the side. You hit it right at the point where half of the wall had collapsed, causing the other half of the wall to immediately shatter and collapse inward, spraying bits of ice and rock against the wall on that side. The ground becomes rough terrain in that general vicinity, but it's easy enough to traverse over without any serious issue. As you guys step over, and the giants make their way across, stepping over it entirely with their long gait. You move carefully over the shattered wall bits, but the ground itself seems solid. You get past without issue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before we go into the actual lair of the dragon-- once we get to it; I don't know much more of these thingies there are. Do we want to go in as if we're offering it something and saying, hey, we love you, we want to bring you people, and stuff like that?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We are here to serve you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or do we want to send somebody in first and act like they're here to serve it, and then we all spring in and surprise it? What do you want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They like to eat giants.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It freezes things, and then it eats them.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, there was another party that the guild-- the guild did send another party.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know if they had a method or if they just walked right in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perhaps if we're quiet and stealthy. Can we be quiet and stealthy?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I can't!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can cast Invisibility.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Ooh, I can cast Invisibility on myself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would help.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So learning of the dragon, will it be able to detect us if we cast Invisibility?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's nature? That would be a nature check or animal handling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be an intelligence check.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh. Well, I can do that. That's a 30-- that's a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They actually have the ability to see with no sight necessary to a certain extent, so invisibility would help at a distance, quite a bit of distance, but within a certain point it is able to sense your presence whether or not it can see you. Also note, if you cast Invisibility you lose your concentration spell on Trinket.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: So that is the key.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we could go in with an offering.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An offering. What if we laid a trap in the offering? What if we used your frag grenade that you did. Is it a bomb? Does it set off on a timer? Is it very fragile?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have to set it off personally. I actually have to shoot it to set it off.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So smile, you son of a bitch, basically, if we put it in his mouth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have any bombs or anything like that? Because I have a very big beautiful diamond of awesomeness that we uncovered before that I keep about. We could present him with this big, huge-ass diamond and then have it trapped with some sort of exploding device.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: If he picks the diamond up off of the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could put it in a bag and then put the diamond on top of a bomb or something, and then when he picks it up and like, (explosion) in his face.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's hoping for an awful lot of things to go our way. More things than normally go our way, to be fair.

lines.name: FELICIA
