lines.text: Well, it seems worthy of trying to get close to him, because his attacks-- Would he as a dragon have a very good length attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, as a dragon has some decent reach with some of its attacks. Its bite, and its length of neck and ability to bite actually has quite a bit of reach. Also, its tail has quite some reach, as well. It can cover some decent ground just with its physical form.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: The thing is, obviously the trolls don't come up here a lot or there wouldn't be so much ice in here. Walls. So I think that's a problem, so it's not as if they come up here all the time to give it treats. Right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could just walk in there. I could be holding Lyra as my captive and say, I've brought you this captive to eat.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I don't like that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you know, you're very appealing.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We still don't know that the giants aren't going to help us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are stepping forward up the pathway, you turn a corner and you can see the giants have stopped, and they have a physical trepidation to the way that they're leaning backward in their stance. As you turn the corner, the little bit of light that reaches out, you can see there appears to be one final ice wall that has a ten-foot opening where it's left as a pathway, and it opens into a darkened chamber.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Well, I have darkvision for 60 feet, so I could approach around the side and peer in and just see what's there, 60 feet ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you walk up past the giants to this entrance? All right. As you walk forward, you see your vision spill out in the darkness, with a little bit of dim light and the darkness before you reveals itself. You can see a smattering of broken bits along the ground, looks like rocks and ice, a frozen leg of some humanoid, an arm, some scattered, broken armor and weapons. There are pieces of what appears to be a frozen-over graveyard of previous attempts towards inhabiting this room. And as you continue to push forward towards the edge, just towards the perimeter as far as your vision can see at this doorway, you see a central platform in the middle of this giant chamber that rises up about 15 feet. Ten, 15 feet, and just cresting over the top of this platform is the edge of an alabaster snout, with teeth overlapping. You hear this (snarls) growling snarl. And this little voice spills out from underneath and says, "Why don't you enter? If "you're going to arrive and present yourselves, do not cower yet."

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Get that diamond out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're going to take a quick ten-minute break to go ahead and use the bathroom, get a little snack. Yes?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: The giveaway includes a signed player's handbook by all your wonderful hosts, as well as the hosts that will be here next week, and a signed copy of Felicia Day's new book.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: My new book! It's right there! I signed it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's it called? What's the title?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's called You're Never Weird on the Internet (Almost).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aw. That's cool.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's amusing.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Are you weird in real life all the time?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No, I mean, look at me.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: No. Definitely not.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I don't believe your face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you consider the title Day Dreaming?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: You're pretty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just thought, because it's like a pun.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: No, that's awful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Consider it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I heard I rolled really well in the beginning of this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it went wonderfully.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry. But your Chain of Returning is attached to your blazing warhammer now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. So as it ends up, we have a new winner. KadenPhilly is the winner, congratulations, of our next giveaway. So we'll be giving away the player's handbook, the signed photo, a copy of Felicia's book-- yay!-- and a bunch of other goodies coming your way soon, so make sure you get your information to the Overlord. We'll have another giveaway at 5,800, if we can get to there by the end of the show tonight, so let's see if we can hit that. In the meantime, guys--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah. Welcome to the shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been watching in the car.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have all been making your way through the cavern back here. Zahra has stepped forward and in the darkness, you can see right here at the edge a form.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: He's up above us, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. About ten, 15 feet up on this platform, leaning over the edge is Rimefang, staring at you through the darkness. A claw comes forward and beckons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I, from here, before we go in there-- I'm going to cast Hunter's Mark on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't see him right now.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zahra can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can, too. I've got my belt of dwarven darkvision.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Is he speaking dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Speaking Common.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: He's speaking Common. Okay.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Would he detect if I would cast anything on him at the moment? I don't know! Then I'm going to sit here and drink my drink.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you offering him that jewel, or did we ditch that idea?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, are we doing that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We might. Depends what he asks. Yeah, let's do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, roll it out like a tennis ball for a dog.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have a little bag we can put the jewels in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't have time to do any of this stuff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have a second. I'm going to hand you my Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch. Why not?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can Hold Monster?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I can Hold Monster. Yeah, we both can.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does he qualify as a monster?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, dragon's pretty much a monster.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am putting Percy's hand grenade inside this bag along with a diamond. Oh, it's a really pretty diamond.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll get it back, it's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As long as it doesn't explode.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can't explode a diamond.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true, diamonds are really strong.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Diamonds are forever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put that in the bag. Are we tossing this at him? What are we doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! We walk in. He's beckoning us. Let's walk in. I'm walking in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys all walk in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here, hold the bag.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take the bag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zahra, are you staying ahead with Scanlan?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I believe that you squishy people should be back here!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not squishy, I go with them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a note, as you guys are walking through and the light hits the walls, you begin to see the ice itself, which you've become accustomed to, is now being broken up into what looks like little glittering stars. It's almost like you're walking through a frozen area of the night sky. You realize that there are gold pieces frozen in sporadically all throughout the wall, the floor, the ceiling here. The actual, whatever wealth this dragon has acquired is in some way shape or form embedded in its own lair. Anyway. So we have the three of you up front. Who's up next? I imagine we've got Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys all continue to move forward?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Not too close!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There? Where do you want to stop? You guys have laser pointers to use, by the way, if you want to point out wherever you want to be.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan should definitely talk to him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to go around here.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh glorious Rimefang, we have an offering for you!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that you? Hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that was you, sorry. So Percy goes here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Over by Percy. But further.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Is that 90 feet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's less than that. We're 30 feet away now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, come on, giants. Help us out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rimefang immediately leans forward. "An offering, you say?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to make my way further up. While he's talking, I want to make my way along the wall a little.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. 20! Natural 20! And all I needed was fried chicken! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where do you want to go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A little bit further. There. That sounds good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Percy, as you're stepping over you realize you're stepping onto what looks like the broken lower half of another giant that has fallen over, a booted leg and part of an eaten armored torso to your back. As you begin to look through, you also see there currently frozen in place three other individuals that are in mid-battle and are frozen solid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If we unfreeze them, they could help us.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: They're probably dead in there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're standing in front of a dragon!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rimefang?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh great Rimefang! What a glorious moon you are amidst the stars of your treasure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, pour it on, why don't you? (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: We do have an offering for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. And I use Mage Hand to lift the diamond out of the bag and dangle it in front of the dragon. We've brought you this diamond. We've come from the Slayer's Take. We represent the guild and we are here to formally apologize for sending a few of our members here in the past and promise that we never shall again, and as a gift of apology and hopefully brotherhood, we offer you this diamond. There are many more to come.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And everything else in the bag, as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then you put it back in the bag. And then you give it to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) "This is your measly offering?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There is a diamond of much greater size and value in this pouch. But first, we want to hear that you are going to allow us safe passage out of here before we turn it over to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Persuasion check.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Guys, just so you know, the stream's buffering, so hold. Twitch problems.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Hold for buffer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do we know at what point it started buffering?

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: You're back up. Missing the last two sentences. Buffer over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Please allow us safe passage. And then you said roll for persuasion, and I rolled a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rimefang's head withdraws back and its claws pull back on top of the platform. It lifts its head up, looking down at you with this very disinterested, snooty look (huffs). As it snorts out of its nose, this puff of frost shoots out and crystals of ice fall and clatter to the ground around it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was so cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You. You trespass into my domain, your voices bickering and bouncing off the walls, "annoying me, waking me from my slumber. My freshly eaten slumber. I am curious, before you so walk "into my dinner table, why you seem to have gotten past my guardians?" At which point the two giants who are standing behind you look over at each other nervously.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your guardians are well aware of our power and position and did not want to offend you by turning us away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are you to tell me I spared your insignificant lives so you could let this "insulting, insufferable insect into the heart of my domain?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm called Burt Reynolds, and I take great offense at that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dragon's head turns to the side for a moment as a glance of confusion and almost amusement that you speak up to it with such a disrespectful manner. (evil laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can call me Mr. Reynolds or simply Burt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Giants. To my side! Tonight, you choose whether I dine on you or just them."

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if you have that spell.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Really, what's the DC on that?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It's very high! I use Awakened Mind to once more say, now we have seen what you have been through. We see the terror that you face every day from this awful beast. This is your chance. You may not have another. Fight him with us and destroy this beast forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check versus the dragon's intimidation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, versus a dragon!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20 all the way. Natural 20. I've had my bow notched, and I cast Hunter's Mark while all this is going on.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 18. 18 plus what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is it, persuasion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Persuasion.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Plus nine. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll initiative.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA, FELICIA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, I rolled lower!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled a 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I rolled another 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me too!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is it with you and your 20s?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know! I don't know what happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, all right. 25 to 20, anyone?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. We have Percy, we have Vex, leaving that up there. All right, we have 20 to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, nice. 15 to ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. Zahra, 12. Ten to five?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven for Scanlan. (laughing) what did you roll?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Negative one! (laughter)

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's our leader!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you roll a natural one?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I rolled a one, and I have a negative two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: On your initiative?!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes! I'm never going. I'm going to just have a snack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You break out the trail mix.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The little gingers come back out.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Is that a record?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is a record. I don't think we've ever had a negative initiative.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as the wings unfurl on top of this platform, the combat round begins with Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If I take one shot, can I hold my second shot until an event? Can I time my second shot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you'd have to hold your initiative, or you do all your actions in one round, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Darn it. What initiative did you roll, again?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Low. Second to last.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In that case, I'm going to take a few steps behind that frozen creature right there. I'm going to pull out Bad News.

lines.name: MARY, SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) Bad News!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to aim for the face. I'm going to take a head shot on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the frozen warrior is in front of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just using him as partial cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're behind the creature. Are you just putting it on it to aim?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 unfortunately does not hit. As you shoot, (gunshot), it actually hits the body but the hardness of the dragon's scales ricochets the shot off, (ricochet sound), you see it impact on some part of the far side of the cavern.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to burn a bonus action and spend another grit point and do another shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're doing your action surge?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm taking my action surge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you use your action surge, and that's it for this round. You use your first round to reload Bad News and place it back up on top.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another head shot, you said?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Oh! 19! That's much better. Plus 12, that's 32 to hit. And that's 15 points of damage, and head shot means he's got disadvantage on all attacks for the next round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to know. So I'm going to go ahead and roll. All right, so. (gunshot) From the impact of the blast, you see the shot ricochet off of Rimefang's face. The impact sends a couple pieces of white dragon scale shooting off into the darkness, and the head (grunts) rears from the impact, shakes, seemingly loosely shaken by the impact of the blast. The blowback from the gun actually sends a large crack through the physical body of the ice warrior ahead of you, and it collapses into a pile of ice on the ground in front of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel a little guilty about that. I feel very guilty about that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the feeling that whatever was there probably has not been alive for quite a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I feel a little better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frozen solid. It breaks like the T-1000.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And he was the most useful he's ever been.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends Percy's turn. We're up at Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to cast Lightning Arrow, and I'm going to attack through my Blazing Bow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Oh, that's good! That is a 25?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25? 25 does hit, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so that is 4d8 of lightning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Saving throw for half? Or just take it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Saving throw for half, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a natural 20 on its saving throw, so it takes half damage.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: That's some stink-eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, better on a saving throw than on an attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you pull back your arrow, the actual shaft begins to spark with bluish energy as you release it. The arrow transforms (energy noises) into an arcing bolt of electrical energy. It impacts and courses through the upper torso of the dragon, as it's (grunts) still trying to shake off the damage it took from Percy's attack. It manages to push off most of the impact, but still takes damage from it. There's also a burst of fire from the impact, as well, you can see a bit of flame trickle up the side of his body and it eventually goes out from the cold in the air.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was one attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But was the spell an action?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Lightning Arrow is a bonus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, okay. So it makes your next attack do that. Right. Gotcha. So you have one more attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I am going to send Trinket. Where is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's over here with the giants guarding him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dear lord. Can Trinket run around and attack his butt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's actually up on top of a 15-foot platform.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so Trinket can't do shit right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not right now, but Trinket can move if you like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's going to move, and I'm going to attack again, can I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We want to spread out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's as far as Trinket get can get, there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I attack again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, I'll hit him again. Okay, just a regular attack through the bow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. This is your second use of it, though; you're done with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. As you fire the arrow, it takes its wing and (whoosh) batters it out of the way, and the arrow shatters in mid air. You see a burst of fire as it does nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a 25 that hit before. What was the first attack that hit?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was in the 30s.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that ends your turn, Vex. Do you want to move, or do you want to stay right there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) No, that's a hide action, I think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then I'm going to move along the wall further. Yeah, like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody, go ahead and make a wisdom saving throw. Everybody. One giant is fine. All right, starting with Percy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20, but it becomes 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Because you're not wise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's rough.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Very wise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, lots of red circles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you are frightened, you have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls, and you cannot willingly move closer to the dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Trinket frightened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Come on, Trinket. No! He's probably pretty frightened. Oh, does that count as intimidation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's a wisdom saving throw. So it's whatever his wisdom bonus is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He rolled an eight, so I'm guessing he's pretty scared.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably scared. Trinket, all of a sudden also (scared bear noises) backs up a little bit and is looking equally frightened, especially seeing you scared. Trinket feels a moment of fear there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've still got a really big dick!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just telling him to encourage him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I missed something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not the dragon. Although, probably the dragon too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got to break it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're scared.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Rage? I look over my shoulder, terrified, at the other one that's scared, and I say, repeat after me, lads. I would like to rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You reach into your inner self, and suddenly you realize this is it. You know dragons, you've fought dragons in the past, you've killed dragons in the past, and you know dragons have been responsible for hurting some of your friends and their families, and through that, that anger just billows up from inside, and that fear shakes from your body.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to kill a dragon like my friend Pike did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're now in a rage. You shake the fear effect, and you can take the rest of your turn as you see fit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (battle cry) I would like to run over that direction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you're running away from it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You rage-ran.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I rage-ran. Can I attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're currently hiding behind a 15-foot platform.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I can't see beyond it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're literally hiding from the dragon right now. Cool. All right, that ends your turn? Zahra, you're up.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, how far away is it from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is currently 30 feet from you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Real fast. Grog, make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was that for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Underneath where you were in the ground is a cracked piece of ice: a pit in the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you're fine. You get back up to your feet. That could've been really bad. It's about 15 feet down into these jagged shards of ice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My passive perception is 21. Just for future reference.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're at the far back in the darkness. Actually, you have Grog around you right now.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And I still have Light cast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so you're fine. All right. That brings us to Zahra, once again.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I cast my bonus Hex on this beautiful beast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is now Hexed, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that do? What's that?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I get extra damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You sexy tailed bastard.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I take my dark dragon staff, and as this moon orb begins to glow, I cast Witch Bolt-- is that it?-- yes! Witch Bolt upon it! Infused with my own internal moon fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Do you have to roll to hit on that one?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Witch Bolt? Yeah, what do I do? It's plus 11. 5d12 plus two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so roll and then add 11.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 24, plus two damage to all spells cast, so 26?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's damage.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Oh, sorry, 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Witch Bolt does hit. Go ahead and roll damage for that.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: So 5d12. Five times. All right. Do math for me, somebody. What is that? That's a three.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three plus the two, so that's five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You do it all and then add the two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, gotcha. Seven.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's four.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Plus four. 19. 26. 38.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: One more?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that's all five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five, and you add 1d6 to that because of your Hex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus two, so 38 is 40.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So 41 points.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus anything else? Wait, plus two damage to all-- oh, but that's already--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's already there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so. After you Hex it, you can see the shadows around the dragon begin to form and coalesce around its torso, and as it looks around, these small demonic faces that cackle as bits of moonlight begin to pierce through these grins chokehold around its neck, and as it tries to shake it off, you bring your staff forward, and this bolt of bluish-green electrical energy shakes out in what looks like a piercing arc of jagged moonlight that strikes right into the center of the dragon's chest. As it does, the dragon's nearly pushed off its feet for a second, gathers itself, and you can see that energy surrounds it like magical shackles, it continues to keep its hold on the creature, as Witch Bolt does. All right. Do you wish to move, or are you going to stay where you are? You can move 30 feet, six squares.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'd like to go stand by the giants.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're already there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're right here. It's hard for you to see because that guy's in the way, but you're right there.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. No, the other way. Blinding players as we go. Where am I? I'm there? I'd like to move to the slight cover of the pedestal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can get that far. All right, so there you are. That ends your turn, Zahra. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My eyes begin to change to a dark shade as I turn my gaze to the dragon and cast Eyebite on him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? Cast what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eyebite.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. And how are you having that affect him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would like to sicken him. Give him a little tummy-ache.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is he going to do the twirls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, we're going to do Eyebite here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Through my Hand Cone of Clarity!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So wisdom saving throw for the dragon. Use my meteor dice one of the fans out there sent. All right, what's the DC on that now total?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. That would fail. It's going to use its legendary resistance to choose to succeed instead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It can just choose to succeed?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many times can it choose to do that?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three times per day. Welcome to fighting a dragon!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? But that was a cool spell!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as your eyes darken, the dragon's currently surrounded by the Witch Bolt and the Hex on the creature. You darken your eyes, and you look over and see the arcane energy taking your vision, its vision, combine it in midair. As you do, it shakes its head and (roars) shouts. You instinctively pull back, and as you do, the spell drifts away from you and you realize the incantation's lost.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy, use your badass motherfucker feat to have it work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, can I throw with a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you going to throw?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A bag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's probably more of an action, but you can drop it as a bonus action.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it. Then I will move a few steps away. I can still move and stuff, right? I would like to move away from this group of soon-to-be-blasted-with-dragon-fire people. Just a few yards away to my left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, going deep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And suddenly, the fear that's getting close to clutching your heart and giving you every instinct to run from this, you hear the name Aldor, and you feel that surge of warmth fill your body, and the need to push on forward. Go ahead and take a d10 inspiration dice to use in any roll you want.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, thank you so much. That's beautiful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I wrote it for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shakes its fright. The other one is going to step over you. As you're like, all of a sudden this foot goes (wham) in front of you, you're like, (nervous sound).

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What were their names? Ace and Base?

lines.name: SAM, MARY
lines.text: Ace and Gary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ending their turn. Lyra, you're up.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, what? Finally me? All right. I am going to get my big spell out. Now, can I target its wing and try to Disintegrate-- can I try to cut its wing off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know what, yeah, if you want to go ahead and try that. It's going to be a disadvantage on the attack roll.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll it twice and you get the lower number.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But does Disintegrate have--

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It doesn't have a DC.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then it would have an advantage on the saving throw.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm like, I just did this and it looked amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which one are you doing?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm doing Disintegrate. And it's 10d6 plus a d10, plus 40. Right? It's not the best roll, guys. There's a lot of small numbers here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's only got plus 40. It's a pretty shrimpy hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, plus 40?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's 10d6 plus 40 force damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I need to get a wand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disintegrate's nasty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 39 plus 40? All right, that's 79 points of damage. What's the DC? It's 17 on that for your spells?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 40 force damage to the dragon. As you, with the swelling of energy that Scanlan gave you reminding you of Aldor, you release and once again that sickeningly green beam of arcane energy just streaks out, hits the dragon, and with a burst of arcane energy you can see part of its scales have withered, part of its wing is now tattered and missing, and immediately the physical form of the dragon, it's reeling in pain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So if we aim at that area that doesn't have scales...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll find out.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: But you've still got the Witch Bolt wrapping around him, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is focused.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I definitely want to move. I want to move over there behind that-- over here. Yeah. So I'm a little less conspicuous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Cool. That will be the top of the round. Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Still no hand-grenade.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. The fear has shaken you, so you cannot move closer to it, and you have disadvantage on attacks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do I do to shake the fear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of your turn, you make a saving throw to try and shake it. You can't move closer to it, but you can still attack it. You cannot move closer to it, and your attacks have disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to try and take a shot at it with a standard shot for right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So because you've shot, reloaded, shot, reloaded. Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 17. Wait, and with disadvantage.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh no. That's a great 20 you can't use.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So a total of 17? As you fire, it would've hit, unfortunately it streaks through the portion of the wing that currently is left a gaping hole thanks to the Disintegrate spell, the impact of the bullet itself blasting against the back wall, sending chunks and shards of ice spilling off in the distance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to really quickly then go into that little corner there for some cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. Cool, so that ends your turn. Vex, you're up next.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I didn't roll to shake off the fear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make the save.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Shake it off.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) Shake it off!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five, yeah. The fear is still clutching you internally, like, "Shit, dragon, bad, dragon!" Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I see him at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now? No. You can see parts of the wings fluttering over, but you don't have a very good visual on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he's pretty far away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's decent distance, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If I just try to (bowstring noise) up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try to. It has three-quarters cover, so it gets a plus five to its armor class.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm at disadvantage. Does it seem like if I cast something that would do mass damage, would the giant then not want to attack with us anymore?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a risk you'd have to take.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Drop some stank on that dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because I want to do Conjure Barrage, but I'm afraid of the giant.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Well, if you do damage to him, the spell breaks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Exactly. So that would be bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But he's not fighting for us because of a spell right now. We convinced him.

lines.name: FELICIA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Potentially.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look at the poker face on that DM. Giving up nothing. Giving up nothing!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Stone-faced.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I try it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. What do I know?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: If we damage it, this spell that I've been talking to him with goes (poof).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, then I'm going to try to hit the dragon with a regular attack. I'm not going to do Conjure Barrage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so what's the first range increment on your longbow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the first range increment? Yeah, it's a longbow, yeah. So you're not at disadvantage from that shot. However, it does have three-quarters cover. And given that circumstance--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does she not have sharpshooter?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't. That's not the feat that I took. I took read lips. I'm really good in populated areas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go for it and roll for the attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: We're going to die!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It actually just barely scrapes the top of the platform and shatters across the ice.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Come on!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's better! 27!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. What is that? 12, 13, 14! Plus a d6, because I'm badass! Plus six! That's 19. That's not even close to 40, but it does something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It (growls)--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I say, fuck you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And it echoes, "Fuck you, fuck you..." Do you or Trinket wish to move?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're as far away as we can be, and I can't move any closer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just roll again. You're frightened.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, both of those sucked. The first one was 20. 20 was the first!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So a total of 20 for the second roll? Well, that would hit. Well no, it has three-quarters cover so it wouldn't, unfortunately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Matthew Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were frightened! It's part of the effect. I had to remind myself that. So the arrow splinters off the top of the wing as it reaches upward, and you still feel the fear clutching your physical self.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now we try to shake it off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you try and shake it off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sings) I shake it off.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: (sings) Shake it off!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First roll is for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do not succeed. It's a three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be a no, sorry. For Trinket?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 20! Why did you say the first one was for me? Why couldn't the second one be for me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because that's how it works. So while you're still scared, you look over and you see Trinket shakes it off. Trinket looks over his shoulder at you and gives you a nod of like, I got this. Turns back to the dragon and gives a (roars) giant grizzly-bear growl and shout at the dragon. Do you wish to move at all?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket's right here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's going to run up for the time being and hide. Give me this.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Hide? Why is everyone hiding?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's not hiding! He's going to run up to this area so that he's got a better vantage point to run up for the next turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's about as far as Trinket can get right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He can't get any further into this little crevice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can he run right here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket could move here instead. That's as far as Trinket could move on his movement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not really protecting him, is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, but it's not over in a cluster of other people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Does that end your turn? Rimefang, who currently has this giant in its face, angrily decides to instead, as a legendary action at the end of your turn, actually, before it takes its turn as you've misfired and Trinket's running along, it's going to go ahead and use one of its legendary actions to do a wing attack against the giant in front of it.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No, Derek!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) Derek. It's Gary.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Gary. He told me telepathically that his name is actually Derek.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is an interesting point. Remember, this is a dragon. It's your favored enemy. So keep that in mind, you have an advantage on attacks against it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I? No, I don't. I looked it up today, yo. I don't get shit on attacks for him because we transferred over from Pathfinder. All I can do is talk to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The chat keeps yelling that the favored enemy--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, chat, I looked it up, and I don't think I have advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shouting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I literally texted Matt today and I was super upset.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Did chat try to challenge the DM?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously, I thought I had it, too, and then I looked it up. In fifth edition, I don't get that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a favored enemy, she gets benefits, but not specifically in battle. It's more about knowing--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I appreciate the chat. Please, keep it coming.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Couldn't that inspire Vex in some way? Don't you get an inspiration roll from the chat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: You know what's good is that it's a different team next week, because we're all going to die.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: No! Lyra, you're our leader, come on!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, chat. You're wrong. Tried to go with you there, but you're wrong.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I shouldn't have even said anything, I should've just gone with you. I'm an idiot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to hit the giant, it's going to hit Lyra, and it's going to hit Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I not have some cover?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So I need both of you guys to go ahead and make a constitution saving throw from the sheer freezing cold.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh no. That didn't go well for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus three.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, that's true. No, that's damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. She gets my inspiration on this throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If she chooses to use it, yes.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes, I definitely want to use it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So add a d10 to what you rolled.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Ten! Thank god, because that's a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21, okay. All right, so both of you take half of the 54 damage it would've dealt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 54 damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both take 27 points of cold damage. The giant that had been partially disintegrated before by Lyra now takes the brunt of the frozen damage, and you can now see the ice begins to build up around it as it (gurgling) gurgles as its life's blood is now stilled. While frozen in place, the ice around its physical form holding it there as a statue of death. The giant is no more.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, go get his axe! It's really big!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it too big to carry? He's got a flaming axe right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to race back from whence I came to attack his right flank, if I could.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could get there. You will have to make-- actually, no, you can move through there without an issue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Also, I have darkvision up to 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You rush up towards the dragon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to take my Firebrand Warhammer and activate it. Ignite it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a bonus action. Well, it's already been ignited, you've had it flaming this whole time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, beautiful, yeah. It's like a torch, which means I can see even better. I'd like to go into a frenzied rage and start swinging away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so three attacks on the big old dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 does hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Beautiful. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Does hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All three hit. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so this is the new thing. d10 plus five plus eight. Plus another--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're hitting with a weapon that's not as big as your greataxe, but you do an additional 1d6 fire damage when you hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit. Ah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: d10 and a d6 together three times. Plus eight to each.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three d10s?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Plus 3d6.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus eight to what you roll on both of those.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You threw a bunch of numbers at me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so a d10 and a d6 plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I do that three times? Oh, wow. 19, and that's 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12, all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 12 and then, help me numbers, that's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good, 16. Plus? Ooh. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hit it a third time, leaving a second giant charred mark where you made impact.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll end your turn. Zahra, you're up.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right, I've still got Witch Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: And it's still going, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have to roll to attack again. You just use your action.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I just fucking keep going with the fucking Witch Bolt. Can I use a cantrip, or will that dispel the Witch Bolt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because most cantrips take an action. So you would not be able to. The Witch Bolt is your action. Almost all cantrips are actions to use them, so you'd be either able to use your action and the Witch Bolt, or use the cantrip. Your choice.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm very happy with this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take your staff and force your will through it once again. That connection between you and the dragon and that weird swirling greenish-blue energy that surrounds the dragon connects with your staff. And as it does, it sends another bolt of otherworldly energy careening into the side of the dragon. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I watch her with my mouth agape.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Five times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We got you.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, 30.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And one more.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, that's five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was five. Then you roll a 1d6 on top of that.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Plus two on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so 38, then a d6 from your Hex.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 44 points of damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it once again, a giant piece of the dragon's scales shatter off the side, like you're cracking into the center of an icy, mountainous cragside. It's starting to show a little bit of damage. You guys are definitely taking this battle head-on pretty well so far.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't like the way he said that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to stay where you are, or are you going to move?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: How close am I to it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're currently 20 feet away from the dragon. 15 is between the two of you.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: All right. I stay within 30 feet of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you want to move this way?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm going to actually, you know what? I'm going to move three feet backwards, that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you just step back? Okay. There you go. All right. That ends Zahra's turn. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How close am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are currently about 20 feet away from the dragon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shamone. I'll just punch him in his dragon face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay. You do a quick little hand gesture, hum to yourself the arcane ritual, and a very large, mystical see-through replica of your fist appears in the air above you and goes spinning off in the air in an arc. Straight up Popeye-punching towards the dragon. (laughs) Let's go ahead, and Bigby-- what do you have to roll for that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I have to roll for that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me see what the effect is on that, remind myself real fast. Bigby's Hand. All right, so it's an AC of 20. Or no, that's the hand, all right. Clenched fist, cool. So make a melee spell attack. So roll a d20 and then add your spell attack modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. (wham) Just barely hits as the fist goes slamming into the side of the dragon's face, big old Popeye punch to the side of the jaw. So go ahead and roll 4d8 points of force damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 4d8. I'm taking yours, and I hope that's okay. Ten, 13, 18, 21. Plus something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's 21 points of damage, nice. (whack) It gets socked in the jaw. The hand whips around again, preparing for the next round. Do you want to use anything, move, use your bonus action?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm 20 feet away. I will go 18 feet away from it and drop the grenade.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you move forward right here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, closer to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The grenade is right there on the ground that Percy made. All right. Going to stay where you are?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I keep moving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can keep moving. You moved 18 feet backward, you mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I had to move closer to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, so you moved three feet of your 25 feet, dropped it, and you still have 22 feet you can move.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But if I leave, he's going to whack me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he's this far away. You have to be within a certain range for him to hit you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, how close did I put the grenade to him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's currently 18 feet away from him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I wanted to put it

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are there, right next to Grog. So yeah, you cannot move away without it taking a swipe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, look at that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello, I'm a little gnome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's adorable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's enough to get there, moves up behind and is going to make two of its axe-swipes.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Hit him in the arse!

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Butthole.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was crass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 doesn't hit. Second attack is going to be a 13. It's rolling shit. It swings twice and manages to catch air.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: The most useless giant.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Apparently. But you know what, they didn't smash you yet. That's a good thing. That brings us to Lyra's turn.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Question. Can I Fireball without hitting anybody who's friendly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this point of view, it's going to be very difficult to pull that off. It's a 20-foot radius, so it's going to hit everything within that sphere.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, you actually care about us that much?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I use-- everybody is really close. All right.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Okay, so I can't do that. I think I'm going to cast Hold Monster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it's going to use its Legendary Resistance to automatically succeed.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: How many of those does he have?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He has one more.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I need to move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) The cage tightens around it, and the dragon takes its wings and (shattering) buffs it off, the arcane cage shatters and disappears into the air.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I was going to be impressive. Okay. I'm going to get the H out. I'm going to get as far as I can in that corner. Yeah, thank you. Bye-bye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to-- That grenade is sitting on top of people right now, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You mean that hamster, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your call, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, live a little.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to hit you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that's all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but it's also going to hit Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have disadvantage on your attacks, by the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Even if my attack is not against the dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As long as it's within eyesight of you, you're scared.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, in that case, I'm going to take a shot at the dragon for the moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Forget about that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage on the shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's nice. 26 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 26 points of damage, nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey! Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have moments.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and you reload with the other one. You can't move closer to it. Do you wish to move at all?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm going to hold my position.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Before the end of your turn--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say, before I do that, I'm going to use a bonus action to do a quick heal. I'm going to use second wind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, a second wind, go for it. So you go ahead and heal yourself 1d10 plus your level.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 11 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shouting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He said it so happily, too. Evil.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're in trouble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what did he do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you drop it, you look up and see its tail go (whoosh, whack).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa, but can I sing real quick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a natural 20. There's no way you can avoid this hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe it'll fling me away from the grenade.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: (singing) Bye bye bye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, not cool!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 36 points of bludgeoning damage as the tail slams down onto you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And also onto the grenade.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it's not a concussion grenade.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I'm right fucking there! I was going to move!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And down onto the grenade you set on the ground. (boom)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it a concussion grenade? It's already armed, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is filled with black powder, and is a triggerable mechanism.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry. I don't know why I said that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want Grog and Scanlan to go ahead and make dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! 21.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on, Scanlan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Both of you guys manage to keep low to the ground, avoiding most of the blast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm already low to the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Both of you guys take half damage from the strike. You both take 12 points of fire and bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did the dragon take damage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dragon does not make its saving throw against it, though, and takes the full-- what'd I tell you guys? 12?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right! The grenade worked! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pulls its tail up, and there's like a big arc of smoke off of its tail as it pulls it up and shakes out the pain that it just suffered.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I take this moment of engineering success to try and pull a wisdom saving throw against my fear that I missed on my turn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, forgot that. So go ahead and make your wisdom saving throw. The explosion was the inspiration you required.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It worked! (cackles)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the explosion the grenade set off, you realize, wait, you might actually have this, and it worked! You could do this!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I built a thing! And it blew up! Kind of on purpose!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I try to shake off the attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of your turn, you do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, at the end. But I was inspired by that explosion!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was inspiring. It may help you shake it off at the end of the round.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to attack it. Oh, that's such a good roll.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That is. Oh, that's even better!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's okay. It was a disadvantage. That's 27 with a disadvantage with the exploding arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the Exploding Arrow? That does hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: More Percy goodness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So what do I do? Do I just roll regular?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With an additional 2d6. Sorry, 3d6. Well, with the arrow, it's 2d6. The grenade was 3d6. You're 2d6.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit. 16 and then 3d6?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 3d8, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. 3d8 was the grenade. 2d8 for the exploding arrow. 2d8.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. It's a lot of numbers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Six additional. Did I say what my other damage was. Was I speaking out loud?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, no. I marked it down. I also need Scanlan and Grog to make dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, I'm sorry, I'm stupid!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what did you just shoot at us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An exploding arrow!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I also meant to say I was shooting from my Blood-Seeker Bow. I pulled it out and said I was going to do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull out your Blood-Seeker Bow?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was going to shoot from my Blood-Seeker Bow for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll let it. So it is now taking an ongoing ten points of bleeding damage? Now, you take three points of fire damage. Scanlan, you take six points of fire damage. You guys avoid the grenade, and then (arrow noises) a second explosion again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sorry. I'm a genius! I'm sorry! Sorry! Oh god, I'm clever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So for my second attack, I want to throw Trinket in and I want Trinket to go up and attack him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket rushes in and is going to make two attacks at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's going to do two claw attacks, so that's 2d4 each time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. So go ahead and roll for the first strike. He's no longer scared, so Trinket does not have the disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, he doesn't hit on the first one. But the second one, he gets a 21!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! Okay. Was I wrong?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: That's 23.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. Either way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It hits even harder!

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It hits harder?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (Irish accent) Exactly. What's that about? Rightly so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's 13 extra damage for Trinket.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rimefang--

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: He has no more of these legendary saves, yes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he has one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, one more legendary resistance.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: He used a wing-buffet and then two saves.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's got one more.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Oh, one more save. Ugh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If he chooses to use it. He might save it for later in the fight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great. So the dragon is now going to (flapping) fly--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he won't. I cast a spell on it as it retreats from me because I am a war caster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't you fly away from me, motherfucker!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So hot for you right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you use your action to do Bigby's Clenched, no, Grasping Hand. No, it's--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's the grapple one to pull its wings together so it can't fly away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. All right, so. So you use the hand's strength score, so go ahead and roll a d20 and then add plus eight to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 18 plus eight. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the dragon brings its wings up, the hand grabs its wings together and forces it back down to the ground. It shakes off the effect, but it's unable to fly away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You will leave when Burt Reynolds tells you to leave! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You also deal 2d6 plus five damage to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 2d6. That's another 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 points of damage as the hand crushes on it, holding it in place, it does not get a chance to move. All right. Angrily, in reaction to that, the dragon-- well, first off let me see. Does not get its breath weapon back yet, unfortunately. It is going to use multiattack, so it gets three attacks: one bite and two claw attacks. It's going to make all of them against you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course it does. And thus ends Scanlan.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll make each attack as it goes. So the first attack against you is going to be the bite attack. That is a 23 to hit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you unconscious?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will be very soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be 18 points of piercing damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, Scanlan's unconscious!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you unconscious? Okay. It would be an additional d8 points of cold damage. Scanlan falls unconscious on the ground. It's going to take a claw attack down. It's already all-in. Its second claw attack hits. You immediately fail a death saving throw from the second strike. The second claw attack hits you, as well, as it's focused on you. You've failed two death saving throws.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the end of his turn. Grog, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I race over to Scanlan and I pour a level-3 healing potion into Scanlan's mouth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the superior one?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You heal 8d4 plus eight hit points.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I roll? Does he roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll let you roll for it; it's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 8d4? Can I roll 4d8s?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) 8d4.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a better chance, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is my friend of the lady favors. I need him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Drink it!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm at 19 now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're at 19 hit points and you're conscious now, the wounds seal up. You've still failed two death saving throws. They're gone until the end of the battle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I do anything else after I've poured it into his-- can I do anything else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a bonus action.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I throw him the fuck away from the dragon? Pick him up and chuck him towards Lyra?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say because you're frenzied raged, normally you would get an additional attack. I will say you can use that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I won't throw. I'll slide him on the icy floor towards Lyra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an athletics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he wakes up, Grog goes (grunts, whoosh) and slip-n-slides you across the icy floor. You come to a stop about 15 feet away-- actually, be about there. You're still prone; you're on the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you can take a potion on your turn, at least?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I just turn around and give it the eyebrow of you're-fucking-dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zahra, you're up.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Witch Bolt. Fucking Witch Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By the way, your Bigby's Hand has faded, because when you fell unconscious you lost concentration. Witch Bolt?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: If you're still within range. I push even harder for Scanlan's sake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and roll 5d12, I believe it is?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: The fire turns from white to yellow. I'm raging. What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever the spell is. Is it 5d10 or 5d12?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: It is 5d12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. 5d12 plus 1d6.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Eight. Give me some math here, guys.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 45 plus two.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Plus 11 attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, 47, and 1d6.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: 1d6. Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so what's the total damage on that, then?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 51 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did I best you on math? It's a dark day when Grog beats Vex on math.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: She's very upset about the whole Scanlan thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm still very scared!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is nasty. All right, so. As you blast again, the fury of seeing Scanlan torn down to the ground and nearly devoured by this dragon, you blast again. This time the greenish-blue energy flaring up into a vibrant, angry yellow, and now you can see what once was almost like a bolt of arcane moon energy becomes an actual burning fire in its visual. Do you wish to move, or are you going to stay where you are?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I'm still how many feet away from him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are currently 20 feet away from him.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I will stay where I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: Can I give-- no I can't, I'd have to go and give it to him, wouldn't I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of your turn, because it's regained its legendary actions, it's going to use a wing attack against Grog and every creature around it, including Trinket and the one giant. So as it takes the hit from the Witch Bolt, (heavy breathing) the arcane hand no longer grasping its wings, its wings flare out, (whoosh) and swings around with its wings, hitting everything around you. Dexterity saving throw for Grog, for the giant, and for Trinket. Giant does not make it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, it's a DC 19. Make it for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Trinket and Grog both take 13 points of bludgeoning damage and are both knocked prone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Halved, because I'm raging.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Halved, because he's got Stoneskin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That ends Zahra's turn. That brings us to Scanlan. You're conscious. You're on the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will stand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you still have half your movement. You can still move roughly ten feet. Any direction.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taking a potion is an action or a bonus?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I consider it a bonus action to keep things moving. Action to administer it to somebody else.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do that thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will Dimension Door way over there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay. Scanlan stands up, waves his hand, and this blackened archway just (whoosh) appears next to him with this crackling sound of energy. He leaps through it and vanishes out of sight. You are now in darkness, you cannot see anything except for a little bit of light bouncing off of the top of the cavern, glittering across all the ice crystals, but you are in complete shadow. (breathing heavily)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'll take one of those four healing potions that someone gave us. Were they moderate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were superior. I think Grog used one.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yeah, we handed them out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I definitely have one, so I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 8d4 plus eight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who all took them?

lines.name: MARY
lines.text: I didn't, because I have two.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I don't think she and I took them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, the four of us, because we're assholes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think you each took one.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I sacrificed myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we'll consider that. It's fine. All right, so that ends Scanlan's turn. The giant is going to get up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get up, Gary, you piece of shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be a 21. That hits. And that'll be a 17. That misses. But it does manage to hit with an attack, finally. This whole time. That's 24 points of slashing damage to the dragon. As its first strike whiffs, and as it brings it back with a backhand, it brings its shield up to protect itself. The axe (smack) lands a good seven to eight inches into the dragon's hide. (roars) The head turns around. "You traitor! I will eat every one of you!" That ends the giant's turn. It's going to stay right there, trying to finish him off. That ends the giant's turn. Lyra, you're up.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I still can't Fireball, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could? Depending on where you want to place it, you may hit other things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can place it-- hit the giant and the dragon.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Then the giant will wake up. If we hit the giants-- does he look almost dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can tell he's taken a few hits from the dragon, but the other one is the one that was completely wrecked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is the other giant dead?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is frozen in place and dead. It was partially disintegrated by Lyra earlier, and the frost breath finished it off.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I could maybe hit Trinket or Grog?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Trinket's protected.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I don't think he's protected from fire damage. It's a lot of damage. I don't want to kill Trinket.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it fire, and it's a frost dragon?

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: It's a very big spell. It's 8d6. Can't really use it. I'll try to Hold Monster again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much radius does the dragon take up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dragon itself is 15 feet across on each side, so if you were to hit the dragon, it would still hit everything directly around it.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: At least force him to use his thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Actually, he fails his saving throw, but uses his third and final legendary resistance to resist the Hold Monster spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good, you drained it. That's over with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's out of legendary resistance. He turns around and looks at you now. It was currently glaring at the giant, growling at everyone around it, and as soon as that spell hits it with the cage once again, (heavy impacts) it breaks it with its wings and turns around, (whoosh) and opens its mouth right towards you.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: I'm going to move away as far as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you are here.

lines.name: FELICIA
lines.text: Yes. That's very far. Yes. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right, that ends your turn. Back up to Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yay! That hits. That's 31 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31 will hit, yeah. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to roll damage. That's 15 points of damage, but he's got disadvantage on all attacks until my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He did take ten points of bleeding damage from your-- Laura. It did take ten points of bleeding damage from your bow, and it does save against the bleed effect, so that's gone, unfortunately. But you did ten additional damage to him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to move in this direction. Hug the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I think right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to move Trinket away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket stands up, and Trinket's going to move back this way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and then hide behind that outcropping thing. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As he moves away, the dragon uses his reaction. It's going to be a bite attack on him, actually.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With disadvantage.
